task.question: Why did the angel of the LORD command Moses to take off his sandals (Ex. 3:5)?

choices.choice: Because he was to be the servant of the LORD
Because the place was holy ground
Because it was necessary for the LORD to visit Moses
Because the people in Egypt were bare foot

task.answer: Because the place was holy ground

task.question: How did God initially identify himself from the burning bush (Ex. 3:6)?

choices.choice: God of your father
God of all
Lord of heaven and earth
God of Joseph

task.question: Why did Moses hide his face after God spoke to him from the bush (Ex. 3:6)?

choices.choice: He realized he was sinful
He humbled himself before God
He was afraid to look at God
He was afraid he was too close to God

task.answer: He was afraid to look at God

task.question: All of the following were cited as reasons why God was appearing to Moses in the bush EXCEPT (Ex. 3:7)

choices.choice: He had seen the misery of his people in Egypt
He had witnessed Pharaoh's attempt to kill Israel's children
He had heard them cry out because of their slave drivers
He was concerned about their suffering

task.answer: He had witnessed Pharaoh's attempt to kill Israel's children

task.question: God was about to rescue Israel to bring them into a land _______

choices.choice: Filled with wheat and barley
Flowing with streams and rivers
Producing olives and figs
Flowing with milk and honey

task.question: God, from the bush, lists all the following inhabitants of Canaan EXCEPT (Ex. 3:8)

choices.choice: Philistines
Hittites
Amorites
Jebusites

task.question: What was to be a sign that God would be with Moses (Ex. 3:12)?

choices.choice: He would defeat and humble Pharaoh
He would worship God on mount Horeb
He would lead Israel through the Red Sea
His children would multiply as the sand

task.answer: He would worship God on mount Horeb

task.question: When Moses asked what God's name was, what most sacred name did God respond with (Ex. 3:14)?

choices.choice: El Shaddai
I am love
I am who I am
The God of your fathers

task.question: What was Moses with the elders of Israel to request from Pharaoh (Ex. 3:18)?

choices.choice: They go three days into the desert to offer sacrifices to God
The Egyptians free them to return to the land of Canaan
Pharaoh give them a sabbatical year for their slavery in Egypt
Lambs, so they could offer up a Passover to the Lord

task.answer: They go three days into the desert to offer sacrifices to God

task.question: What did God say he would have to do before Pharaoh would let the Israelites leave Egypt (Ex. 3:20)?

choices.choice: Turn the Nile River into blood
Destroy the crops of Egypt in a famine
Soften Pharaoh's heart
Strike the Egyptians with wonders
